intro: Vochysia lopezpalacioi, commonly known as the Lopezpalacio's vochysia, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often found in humid, lowland forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. Vochysia lopezpalacioi is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
